entry.title: desaturating electronic life :: saturating real life.
mathematical literacy :: init.
entry.content:
please note that this blog post is really raw and more like a journal update for me its public just for the sake of putting it out there.

message excerpt:
[02/12/2025, 23:27] i want to get like mathematically literate if that makes sense
[02/12/2025, 23:27] im thinking of like doing --'s cambridge stuff and i found notes that should match with their syllabi
[02/12/2025, 23:28] i dont think i wanna pursue math as a career but yea

stuff

  • tripos syll.

part I-A

differential equations

i haven't had a proper course on it ever, just JEE stuff and we'll have our math3 course in 2-1 (read 2nd year, 1st semester)

rsrcs:

  • boyce
  • MIT 18.03

** i think i really enjoy differential equations quite a bit so this should be really fun

groups

i didn't cover the entire playlist i was doing back in july, nor do i think ill have formal education on it during my degree

rsrcs:

  • pinter or armstrong
  • hlom
  • the course on the playlist

numbers and sets

i don't have any particular opinions on this? this was covered pretty okayish during jee prep but i feel like this is one of the most important foundation blocks of math so i need to cover it in depth pretty sure uepyep

rscrs:

  • i intend to use velleman

vectors and matrices

i have covered gilbert strangs linear algebra course for funsies during jee prep and will also be having linalg as my only math course in my 1-2 so i dont think i need to do much in it other than revision and notes and those sheets üëç

probability and statistics

i have had a course on PnS this sem, but again thats basically from an engg pov so idk ive done my course work from:

  • lecture slides
  • milton
  • devore

i will try to do it again from a more mathematical pov,if i feel like it but im not too sure yepyep

rsrcs:

  • sheldon ross
  • mit 6.041

multivariable calc

i have had a course on this too this sem, and i think im pretty ok w it, i have done my course work from:

  • lecture slides
  • thomas

i do know that its just application based mvc and not really theoretically solid and proof based so ill brush that up with smth

rscrs:

  • schaum

dynamics and relativity

i have done a good amount of physics during jee, and will be having to deal with relativity in my coursework coming on so ill probably will be skipping this section

i might just do a bit of relativistic physics from somewhere but yeah not too keen on doing it rn

analysis

okay i practically have 0 toes wet in this and hence 0 prior opinions/knowledge

i have heard a lot about baby rudin and abott in circles sooo

rsrcs:

  • abott
  • rudin

easter sem

sooo i only want to do optimisation, hamiltonian, lagrangian (i did a bit of it during jee), and maybee computational projects

idrk about this but yea we shall see
